abstract: Archaeologists in Peru find cache of Incan accounting devices known as khipus in food storage house where they were used; discovery promises to help decipher system used by ancient civilization to record data of various types.
lead_paragraph: Archaeologists have made a discovery they hope could help unravel one of the most tenacious mysteries of ancient Peru: how to read the knotted string records, known as khipus, kept by the Incas.

headline.main: Untangling an Accounting Tool and an Ancient Incan Mystery
headline.print_headline: Untangling an Ancient Accounting Tool and a Stubborn Incan Mystery

snippet: Archaeologists have made a discovery they hope could help unravel one of the most tenacious mysteries of ancient Peru: how to read the knotted string records, known as khipus, kept by the Incas.
